abstract: The Supreme Court has finally righted a bankruptcy muddle created by the appeals courts.
snippet: The Supreme Court has finally righted a bankruptcy muddle created by the appeals courts.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court has finally righted a bankruptcy muddle created by the appeals courts and their apparently limited understanding of the wonder that is Title 11. And they did it in an 11-page, unanimous (8-0; Justice Anthony M. Kennedy did not participate) decision. RadLAX Gateway Hotel, LLC v. Amalgmated Bank will make for an interesting comparison with the coming health care reform decision.

headline.main: High Court Upholds Ability to ‘Credit Bid’
